The euro turns 20 this year. To mark this milestone, next week’s #ECBForum will focus on the euro’s first 20 years and on the future of growth in the euro area. See our #EUROat20 hub page for more info and watch the event live via webcast next week https://t.co/meiCHZ15eL https://t.co/ehMD7ATeWF

To further promote the international role of the euro and boost its international appeal, policies for a deeper and more complete economic and monetary union (EMU) are essential https://t.co/b3M85wfNSU

The euro’s international role slightly strengthened in 2018 and early 2019, recovering from the lows of the global financial crisis. In particular, the euro’s share in global foreign exchange reserves and international debt issuance increased https://t.co/fdXZMLhoqw https://t.co/77L7KA0K6o
The euro has consistently been one of the top two most used currencies globally since its introduction 20 years ago – second only to the US dollar https://t.co/rEwnNuhc1b https://t.co/Y4PjTJ82tN

#AnneFrank, who – like Edith – was born in Frankfurt, would have been 90 today. She is best known for her diary, written when she and her family were in hiding during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands. Anne Frank did not survive the Holocaust.

Edith Erbrich is a Holocaust survivor. In 1945, she was deported to a concentration camp from the Grossmarkthalle in Frankfurt, now part of our main building. Today she regularly visits the on-site memorial to tell her story, keeping it alive for future generations. https://t.co/fZWZtOFLPY

Dėkojame @Lietuvosbankas už surengtą Valdančiosios tarybos posėdį!

Our thanks go to @Lietuvosbankas  for hosting this Governing Council meeting! https://t.co/bGJaodvuM0
Eurosystem staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area (June 2019) https://t.co/Az8ogrFs6C
ECB announces details of new targeted longer-term refinancing operations (TLTRO III) https://t.co/jYjRsGO819
Draghi: In terms of inflation expectations, of course we are concerned, but we don’t see signs of de-anchoring or deflation
Draghi: Use of forward guidance has been quite successful in steering market expectations.  It has become the major monetary policy tool.
Draghi: Current conditions are not comparable with the conditions we had seven years ago; we have growth in employment and rising wages - but certainly we have to be prepared
Draghi: Discussion about a possible further rate cut concerned the deposit facility rate
Draghi: It is absolutely essential to coordinate anti-money laundering activities across countries and across authorities.  We should create a European authority to deal with money laundering.
Draghi: The policy space is there and if contingencies materialize we stand ready to act
Draghi: Goal of TLTRO is to increase lending to the economy
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/8RrjMzNIva
Draghi: Today’s decisions were unanimous
Draghi: We have not discussed which contingency would call for which instrument
Draghi: 'Minibots' are either money and then they are illegal or they are debt and then the stock of debt goes up. I don’t think there is a third possibility.
Draghi: Several members of the Governing Council raised the possibility of rate cuts, others the possibility of restarting the APP or the extension of forward guidance
Draghi: Discussion in Governing Council was centered on three key concepts: confidence in baseline, but prolonged uncertainties, readiness to act in case of adverse contingencies
Draghi: Markets see the threat of protectionism questioning the multilateral order
Draghi: Extension of forward guidance takes into account prolongation of uncertainties

Draghi: The mildly expansionary euro area fiscal stance supports economic activity. However, countries where government debt is high need to continue rebuilding fiscal buffers. All countries should achieve a more growth-friendly composition of public finances.

Draghi: The implementation of structural reforms needs to be substantially stepped up to increase resilience, reduce structural unemployment and boost productivity and growth potential, with the 2019 country-specific recommendations serving as the relevant signpost

Draghi: In order to reap the full benefits from our monetary policy measures, other policy areas must contribute more decisively to raising the longer-term growth potential and reducing vulnerabilities
Draghi introduces the GDP and inflation outlook for the euro area https://t.co/pv8VrgTepl

Draghi: The Governing Council is determined to act in case of adverse contingencies and also stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, to ensure that inflation continues to move towards the Governing Council’s inflation aim in a sustained manner

Draghi: Today’s policy measures ensure that financial conditions will remain very favourable, supporting the euro area expansion, the ongoing build-up of domestic price pressures and, thus, headline inflation developments over the medium term
Draghi: Further employment gains and increasing wages continue to underpin the resilience of the euro area economy and gradually rising inflation

Draghi: Despite better than expected data for Q1, most recent information indicates global headwinds still weighing on euro area outlook. Geopolitical uncertainties, rising protectionism threat and vulnerabilities in emerging markets leave their mark on economic sentiment.

Draghi: Currently, the positive contribution of negative interest rates to the accommodative monetary policy stance and to the sustained convergence of inflation is not undermined by possible side effects on bank-based intermediation. We will continue to monitor though.

Draghi: Second, we will continue to reinvest, in full, the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the asset purchase programme for an extended period of time past the date when we start raising the key ECB interest rates
Draghi: First, we decided to keep interest rates unchanged and expect them to remain at present levels at least through the first half of 2020
Draghi: Following a thorough assessment of the economic and inflation outlook, the ECB has taken a number of decisions in the pursuit of its price stability objective

What are the benefits of countercyclical capital buffers? When times are tough they can be used to support the financial system and economy, for example by supporting real economic activity and lowering lending rates. Read our Financial Stability Review https://t.co/hkKHZRU4VU
